text: John Anthony Pitt (born 30 January 1939) is a former English first-class cricketer. While undertaking his national service as a non-commissioned officer in the British Army, Pitt made a single appearance in first-class cricket for the Combined Services cricket team against Warwickshire at Birmingham in 1957. Batting twice in the match, Pitt scored 10 runs in the Combined Services first-innings before being dismissed by Michael Youll, while in their second-innings he remained unbeaten with 26 runs. He also bowled three overs with his right-arm medium pace in Warwickshire's first-innings, without taking a wicket. ==References== ==External links== * Category:1939 births Category:Living people Category:Cricketers from Dewsbury Category:English cricketers Category:Combined Services cricketers
title: John Pitt (cricketer)
